scripts.COMMENT STATEMENT FOR THE ios SHORTCUT B: The npx react-native run-ios --simulator='iPhone 15 Pro Max' commmand requires the device to be booted 1st,
so the ios shortcut boots up the device 1st before running using the xcode command line,
i got the list of the UUIDs by running the xcrun simctl list devices command
scripts.ios15Max: xcrun simctl boot D1EB5D51-FC01-4128-B8B0-23F3DF2D189A && npx react-native run-ios --simulator='iPhone 15 Pro Max'
scripts.ios14Plus: xcrun simctl boot 61E24D68-23A1-48FD-991D-6C81255BBC41 && npx react-native run-ios --simulator='iPhone 14 Plus'
scripts.ios8Plus: xcrun simctl boot BD1AB189-2918-43BC-80BA-63D61A810FCB && npx react-native run-ios --simulator='iPhone 8 Plus'
scripts.clean: cd /Users/croncallo/repo/MovieApp && rm -fr node_modules && rm -fr ios/Pods && rm -fr ios/build && rm -fr android/build && rm -fr android/.gradle && rm -fr android/app/build && npm cache clean --force
scripts.appinstall: cd /Users/croncallo/repo/MovieApp && npm install && cd /Users/croncallo/repo/MovieApp/ios && pod install && cd /Users/croncallo/repo/MovieApp
